fields.title: Welcome to Django-Jodit!
fields.content:
What is Django-Jodit?

Django-Jodit is a powerful integration of the Jodit WYSIWYG editor with Django. It provides an intuitive rich text editing experience for your Django applications.

Key Features

  • üé® Full-featured WYSIWYG editor - Format text, add images, create tables, and more
  • üìù Easy integration - Works seamlessly with Django forms and admin
  • ‚öôÔ∏è Highly configurable - Customize the editor to match your needs
  • üéØ Multiple configurations - Use different editor setups for different fields

How It Works

This blog post was created using the default Jodit configuration, which includes all editor features. The excerpt below uses a simple configuration with basic formatting only.

"The best WYSIWYG editor for Django applications!"

Getting Started

  1. Install django-jodit: pip install django-jodit
  2. Add 'jodit' to your INSTALLED_APPS
  3. Use RichTextField in your models
  4. Enjoy rich text editing!

Check out the GitHub repository for more information.

fields.title: Rich Text Formatting Examples
fields.content:
Text Formatting

The Jodit editor supports various text formatting options:

  • Bold text for emphasis
  • Italic text for quotes or titles
  • Underlined text for highlighting
  • Strikethrough text for corrections

Lists

Ordered List

  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item

Unordered List

  • Bullet point one
  • Bullet point two
  • Bullet point three

Links and Code

You can easily add hyperlinks to your content.

Inline code: print('Hello, Django-Jodit!')

fields.title: Configuration Examples
fields.content:
Customizing the Editor

Django-Jodit allows you to create multiple editor configurations for different use cases.

Default Configuration

This post uses the default configuration with all features enabled:

  • Full toolbar with all buttons
  • 400px height
  • Character and word counter
  • Spell checker
  • Image upload support

Simple Configuration

For comments or short excerpts, you might want a simpler editor with just basic formatting:

  • Limited toolbar (bold, italic, underline, link)
  • 200px height
  • No counters or extra features

Custom Configuration

You can create your own configurations in settings.py:

JODIT_CONFIGS = {
    'my_custom': {
        'height': 300,
        'buttons': ['bold', 'italic', 'link', 'image'],
        'showCharsCounter': False,
    }
}

Using Configurations

Apply configurations to your fields:

class Post(models.Model):
    # Full editor
    content = RichTextField()
    
    # Simple editor
    excerpt = RichTextField(config_name='simple')
    
    # Custom editor
    notes = RichTextField(config_name='my_custom')

Try It Yourself

Edit this post in the admin panel or create a new one to see the different configurations in action!
